subs.text: @keitholberman makes a good point. "Good government" is too subtle a pitch. The Repubs shit all over us. We have to stand up for Uncle Sam. If the president won't do it, get a new president. That's how people think --> Dems. It is what it is. They have to fight.

subs.text:
Feature request for @amazonmusic. 

I live in an area with no cell service.

It takes about ten minutes to drive to where there is service.

I'd like to have my queue not run out for ten minutes. 

Could it learn?

PS: My phone has lots of memory.

subs.text: 1/2 I've been working outside an office for over 30 years, except for a brief period when i had an office at berkman. because i had the office, i was able to get an experienced radio team (lydon and mcgrath) to work with me on this idea i had for audio blogging (which became
subs.rawText: 1/2 I've been working outside an office for over 30 years, except for a brief period when i had an office at berkman. because i had the office, i was able to get an experienced radio team (lydon and mcgrath) to work with me on this idea i had for audio blogging (which became

subs.text: 2/2 podcasting) and one of my colleagues suggested that blogging would work well with politics, which got the bootstrap of political blogging going. so -- having an office and using it is good. things get created that way that otherwise wouldn't.
subs.rawText: 2/2 podcasting) and one of my colleagues suggested that blogging would work well with politics, which got the bootstrap of political blogging going. so -- having an office and using it is good. things get created that way that otherwise wouldn't.

subs.text:
I unfollowed @Wirecutter because every time I go there I hit a paywall, even though I am a NYT subscriber. 

I get that it costs more. Fine. But if your links on Twitter always link to a paywall, well I think maybe there should be a way for me to know, eh?

cc @TwitterDev
subs.rawText:
I unfollowed @Wirecutter because every time I go there I hit a paywall, even though I am a NYT subscriber.

cc @TwitterDev

subs.text:
The reason I suggest it is that a link is kind of an ad.

It says if you click here you’ll learn about all this. You see a picture of the product, descriptive text, a pitch.

But when you click you realize you’ve been fooled. 

It could be seen as unethical. False advertising.
subs.rawText:
The reason I suggest it is that a link is kind of an ad.

It says if you click here you’ll learn about all this. You see a picture of the product, descriptive text, a pitch.

But when you click you realize you’ve been fooled. 

It could be seen as unethical. False advertising.

subs.text:
@jeffjarvis Jeff, I agree with you on almost everything -- but not this. 

There are plenty of middle class and upper middle class people who vote Republican, still. 

Definitely not trailer trash.

I meet them in various contexts.
subs.rawText:
@jeffjarvis Jeff, I agree with you on almost everything -- but not this. 

There are plenty of middle class and upper middle class people who vote Republican, still. 

Definitely not trailer trash.

I meet them in various contexts.

subs.text: @jeffjarvis Hard to believe educated well-off people don't see the danger, but I have to say I used to vote Republican myself, in the 80s and 90s.
